0.title: Those who should protect Kashmiri Pandits are busy promoting film: Rahul
0.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said those who should be protecting Kashmiri Pandits are busy promoting a film (The Kashmir Files). Referring to the targeted killings in Kashmir, Gandhi said, "Bank manager, teacher and many other innocent people are being killed everyday, Kashmiri Pandits are fleeing." "Take immediate steps to restore peace in Kashmir, Prime Minister ji," he added.

1.title: 20 'mini-forests' to be built in Ghaziabad by the end of 2022
1.article_body: The Ghaziabad municipal corporation is planning to create 20 'mini-forests' across the city by the end of this year to improve the greenery and forest cover, officials said. Officials added that four other plantation sites which were developed as a pilot project, showed a plant survival rate of about 95%. The plantation drive at these sites was initiated in 2021.

2.title: 45-yr-old Noida man arrested for assaulting his 70-yr-old mother
2.article_body: Police said that they arrested a 45-year-old man for allegedly assaulting his 70-year-old mother at their house in Noida. The accused, Manoj, got into a fight with his mother Jagvati Devi on May 28, after which he assaulted her with a stick and other heavy objects, police added. A video of the woman's injuries was shared on social media platforms.

3.title: US, NZ smeared our cooperation with Pacific countries: China
3.article_body: China on Wednesday accused the US and New Zealand of "smearing" its cooperation with Pacific nations. China's reaction comes in response to a joint statement by US President Joe Biden and New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern, expressing concern about possible Chinese military presence in the Pacific. Notably, 10 Pacific countries recently refused to sign trade and security deal with China.

4.title: Man gets life term for killing his factory owner's wife in Thane
4.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Manoranjan Mahakand, was sentenced to life imprisonment by a court in Maharashtra's Thane for killing his factory owner's wife in 2016. Additional public prosecutor told the court that Mahakand visited his factory owner's house often and fell in love with his wife. During such visit, he suspected her of being in love with someone and killed her.

5.title: Hyd student kills self allegedly after being harassed by TRS corporator
5.article_body: A B.Tech student in Hyderabad allegedly died by suicide after hanging himself from the ceiling in his house on Thursday. The family of the victim, Sharath, has alleged that he killed himself over harassment by a Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) corporator. Reportedly, the corporator attacked the student over a civil dispute two days ago.

6.title: Modi government is behaving worse than Congress: AIADMK
6.article_body: The All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) organisational secretary C Ponnaiyan criticised its ally BJP saying PM Narendra Modi-led government at the Centre is behaving worse than Congress. Calling BJP anti-Tamil, Ponnaiyan said, "Tamil Nadu should be given an exemption in language policy." He further alleged that the BJP is continuously "imposing" Hindi despite AIADMK's opposition.

7.title: Heatwave warning issued for 6 states; IMD releases list
7.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted heatwave conditions in isolated pockets of Rajasthan on June 3. The IMD also said that heatwave condition is likely over south Punjab, south Haryana, south Uttar Pradesh and north Madhya Pradesh on June 3 and 4 and over Maharashtra till June 5. Rainfall has been predicted in several states on Thursday.

8.title: Hrithik's cousin Pashmina Roshan to make her B'wood debut with Ishq Vishk sequel
8.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan's cousin Pashmina Roshan will make her acting debut with Shahid's 'Ishq Vishk' sequel, along with Rohit Saraf, Jibraan Khan, and Naila Grewal. Sharing the video announcement on Instagram, Pashmina wrote, "I'm extremely excited...to bring to you my first experience on screen." Congratulating Pashmina, her uncle, filmmaker Rakesh Roshan, commented, "Congratulations to all."

9.title: Monsoon enters northeast, heavy rains likely in Assam, Meghalaya: IMD
9.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Thursday said southwest monsoon has entered northeast India and is set to bring heavy rains over Assam and Meghalaya over next two days. IMD has forecast fairly widespread rainfall over coastal and south interior Karnataka, Kerala, Mahe and Lakshadweep over next five days. Heatwave warnings have been issued over Rajasthan, south Punjab and south Haryana.

10.title: Santoor maestro Pandit Bhajan Sopori passes away aged 73 due to cancer
10.article_body: Santoor maestro Pandit Bhajan Sopori passed away on Thursday aged 73. "He was suffering from colon cancer. He...would have celebrated his 74th birthday on June 22," his son Abhay Sopori stated. He added that his father passed away at 3:30 pm and was "ailing in the hospital for the last three weeks".

11.title: You cannot belittle any language: Kamal Haasan on national language debate
11.article_body: Sharing that language is a part of a person's culture and community, actor Kamal Haasan said, "A language is far more ingrained in a person, it's part of his culture. It's bigger than community sometimes. You cannot belittle any language." "I'm...proud (of our national anthem) but I don't question why the national anthem isn't there in my language," he added.

12.title: Gerard  Piqué caught cheating by Shakira, couple set to separate: Report
12.article_body: Singer Shakira and footballer Gerard  Piqué are on the verge of splitting up after she caught him cheating with another woman a few weeks back, said reports. As per a report in El Periodico, Piqué moved out from the house he shares with Shakira and has been living alone in Barcelona. The report claimed that Piqué lives a "party lifestyle".

13.title: Russia occupies 20% of Ukraine's territory: Zelenskyy
13.article_body: Russia now occupies about 20% of Ukraine's territory, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said while addressing Luxembourg's Parliament on Thursday. The front lines of battle are stretched across over 1,000 kilometres, he added. "We have to defend ourselves against almost the entire Russian army. All combat-ready Russian military formations are involved in this aggression," he further said.

14.title: After UP, Madhya Pradesh makes Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' tax-free
14.article_body:
Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday announced that 'Samrat Prithviraj', featuring actor Akshay Kumar and actress Manushi Chhillar, will be made tax-free in the state. 
Chouhan said the decision was taken so that more people watch the movie. Earlier in the day, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath declared the movie tax-free.

15.title: Bank manager Vijay 8th victim of targeted killings in J&K since May 1
15.article_body: Vijay Kumar, a bank manager who was shot dead by a terrorist in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam on Thursday, is eighth victim of targeted killings in Kashmir since May 1. On May 31, a female teacher was shot dead at a school in Kulgam. A man was killed after terrorists attacked a newly-opened wine shop in Baramulla on May 17.

16.title: UN approves request to change Turkey's official name to 'Türkiye'
16.article_body: UN on Wednesday approved Turkey's request to change its official name to 'Türkiye', Stephane Dujarric, spokesman for UN chief Antonio Guterres said. Dujarric stated the name change became effective after UN received Turkish government's letter requesting use of 'Türkiye' for all affairs. "Türkiye is the best representation...of...[our]...culture," President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan had earlier said.

17.title: He's had a disgusting year at every level: Jerome Rothen on Messi
17.article_body: Ex-PSG player Jerome Rothen said PSG forward Lionel Messi has had a disgusting year at every level. "If you can't run, don't come to the field...On the field, you're judged as a 100 [percent] player," added Rothen. "The concern for adaptation can happen to all players. But we are talking about the best player on the football planet," stated Rothen.

18.title: Rather good news: Real Madrid's Hazard on Mbappé not joining Madrid
18.article_body: Real Madrid forward Eden Hazard said Paris Saint-Germain forward Kylian Mbappé's decision to extend his contract with PSG rather than signing for Madrid is "good" news. "Competition for places is already tough at Real but with...Mbappé they would have become even more tough," added Hazard. Real Madrid president Florentino Perez earlier said that Mbappé has "already been forgotten".

19.title: 10-yr-old boy bitten by snake in Kerala school on 2nd day of reopening
19.article_body: A 10-year-old boy was bitten by a snake inside the premises of a government school in Kerala's Thrissur district. The incident occurred on Thursday, a day after schools in the state reopened for the new academic year. The child was reportedly bitten by a viper after alighting from the school bus. He was rushed to a government hospital, reports added.

20.title: Wish you a speedy recovery: PM Modi to Sonia Gandhi after she tests COVID-19 positive
20.article_body: After Congress announced that the party's interim President Sonia Gandhi has tested positive for COVID-19, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Wishing Congress President Smt Sonia Gandhi Ji a speedy recovery from COVID-19." Congress said that she developed mild symptoms and has isolated herself, adding, "As of today, her date of appearance before Enforcement Directorate on June 8 stands as it is."

21.title: Western viewers tweet RRR is a gay movie, Ram Gopal Varma says 'I was right'
21.article_body: After several viewers from West took to Twitter to say that 'RRR' is a gay movie, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma tweeted, saying, "I was right." Varma attached a news report about people calling the movie gay with his tweet. "Jaw-dropping action, yes...Adventure, yes...Revenge, yes...But why did none of you tell me RRR movie was so heartwarmingly gay??" a viewer wrote.

22.title: Delhivery shares surge 15%, touch their highest-ever price of ₹617
22.article_body: Shares of Delhivery rose to their highest-ever price of ₹617.35/share on Thursday after Credit Suisse initiated coverage with an 'outperform' rating. Shares of Delhivery, which were listed on May 24, were up ₹81.7, or 15%, compared with its closing price of ₹535.65 recorded on Wednesday. The shares have risen 26.7% from their IPO issue price of ₹487/share.

23.title: Mobile app developed to alert people about lightning, give trigger warnings
23.article_body: Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (IITM-Pune) and Earth System Science Organisation (ESSO) under Ministry of Earth Sciences have developed Damini mobile application to alert people about lightning. Reports said the app alerts users about lightning near them by GPS notification under 20 km and 40 km and also gives trigger warnings about lightning strikes one or two hours in advance.

24.title: Who is 44-year-old Javier Olivan, Meta's next COO?
24.article_body: Javier Olivan, who is replacing Sheryl Sandberg as Meta's next COO, has been working with the company since October 2007. Olivan, who hails from Spain, did his electrical and industrial engineering from University of Navarra and MBA from Stanford University. Before joining Facebook in late 2007 as head of international growth, the 44-year-old worked at Japan's NTT and Siemens.

25.title: KK felt unwell, wanted to leave but wasn't allowed: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
25.article_body: Following singer KK’s demise in Kolkata, BJP leader Dilip Ghosh on Thursday said the singer was "forced to sing despite complaining of uneasiness". "He was feeling unwell and sweating. He wanted to leave but was not allowed. He was murdered," Ghosh added. Meanwhile, TMC's Kunal Ghosh said, "It's BJP’s culture to engage in such cheap and ugly politics over death."

26.title: Rachakonda Police wishes people on Telangana Formation Day
26.article_body: The Rachakonda Police greeted the people on the occasion of the Telangana Formation Day on Thursday. "Salutes to all those martyrs who sacrificed their lives for the state," the police said on Twitter. Earlier in the day, CM K Chandrashekar Rao hoisted the national flag and paid tributes to martyrs who sacrificed their lives during the separate state movement.

27.title: South Africa President accused of 'kidnapping' & bribing burglars
27.article_body: An ex-South African spy agency chief has sued President Cyril Ramaphosa for allegedly "kidnapping" and bribing robbers who stole $4 million from one of his properties. Arthur Fraser alleged that burglars broke into Ramaphosa's Johannesburg farm on February 9, 2020. Following this, Ramaphosa organised "kidnapping of suspects, their interrogation on his property" and later paid them to stay quiet.

28.title: I'll give 9/10 to Du Plessis for his captaincy in IPL 2022: Aakash
28.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said Faf Du Plessis absorbed the pressure of leading RCB and was a very good captain in IPL 2022. "Faf's captaincy was good...9/10 for [his] captaincy...he got the best out of his players. I think he [also] created a great environment in the side," added Aakash. RCB lost to RR in Qualifier 2 of the tournament.

29.title: Yes Bank plans to sell pool of stressed assets to JC Flowers: Report
29.article_body: Yes Bank is planning to sell a pool of stressed assets worth ₹48,000 crore to US-based JC Flowers Asset Reconstruction Company (ARC), BQ Prime reported. JC Flowers has agreed to place a ₹12,400-crore bid against the stressed assets on sale, ensuring a 25% recovery. Yes Bank will have to invest ₹300-400 crore in the ARC as part of the deal.

30.title: Ahmednagar should be renamed as Ahilyanagar: BJP leader to Maha CM
30.article_body: BJP leader Gopichand Padalkar has written a letter to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray demanding that Ahmednagar should be renamed as Ahilyanagar. "She reconstructed temples that were destroyed by Muslim rulers. Thus, Ahmednagar should be renamed, as a tribute to her, as Ahilyanagar," Padalkar wrote. "Hindurajmata Punyashlok Ahilyadevi Holkar is an inspiration for Hindustan," he added.

31.title: After Moosewala's murder, Punjab govt to restore security cover of 400 VVIPs from June 7
31.article_body: Punjab government on Thursday told the Punjab and Haryana High Court that it will restore the security cover of over 420 VVIPs from June 7. This comes after singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Mansa on Sunday, a day after the state government had withdrawn the security cover of 424 VVIPs in Punjab with immediate effect.

32.title: Biden announces new $700 million weapons package for Ukraine
32.article_body: US President Joe Biden has announced a new weapons package worth $700 million for Ukraine to help it fight Russian forces. The package includes high mobility artillery rocket systems which, Ukraine has assured, will not be used against targets on Russian territory, according to the US. The US will continue to provide Ukraine with weapons to defend itself, said Biden.

33.title: India will send fertilisers to Sri Lanka to avert food shortages
33.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's economic crisis, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's office said on Thursday that India has assured the supply of fertilisers to avert food shortages. This comes days after Sri Lankan government requested farmers to boost paddy cultivation. Sri Lanka, which is reeling under a forex crisis, needs an estimated $600 million to import fertilisers, PM Ranil Wickremesinghe had earlier said.

34.title: Nobody's safe: J&K govt employees protest, demand transfer to home districts
34.article_body: Several government employees posted in Kashmir carried out a march on Thursday to protest against the recent targeted killings in the valley and demanded a transfer to their respective home districts. "We are serving there for...15 years but...feeling insecure...in view of...spurt in...targeted killings," a protestor said. "Nobody, including Muslims, Hindus and Sikhs are safe," he added.

35.title: Amit Shah meets NSA Ajit Doval amid targeted killings in Kashmir
35.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday met National Security Advisor Ajit Doval amid targeted killings in Kashmir. The meeting lasted for over an hour. Shah will meet Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha with other security officials, including RAW chief Samant Goel, over the issue on Friday.

36.title: I'd request for auditoriums to have medical facilities: Abhijeet on KK's death
36.article_body: After singer KK's death, singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya said that he would like to request auditoriums that have large crowds to have a medical van and medical facilities. He also said that he is a big fan of KK and the late singer's songs are often played in his house. He added that his son also tries to sing KK's songs.

37.title: Self-destructive: Moscow on EU's move to phase out Russian oil
37.article_body: Russia has called the European Union's move to cut 90% of oil imports from Russia by year-end "self-destructive". "The European Union's decisions to partially phase out Russian oil and oil products, as well as to ban insurance on Russian merchant ships, are highly likely to provoke further price increases, destabilise energy markets, and disrupt supply chains," Russian Foreign Ministry said.

38.title: India's digital payment industry to reach $10 tn by 2026: Report
38.article_body: A report by PhonePe in collaboration with Boston Consulting Group (BCG) has said that India's digital payments market is at an "inflection point" and is expected to more than triple from the current $3 trillion to $10 trillion by 2026. Digital payments' overall share will reportedly grow to 65% in 2026 and will constitute two out of three payment transactions.

39.title: Canada accuses Chinese warplanes of harassing its patrol aircraft
39.article_body: The Canadian military on Wednesday accused Chinese warplanes of harassing its patrol aircraft on a UN mission to monitor sanctions against North Korea. The Chinese aircraft approached the Canadian plane on several occasions between April 26 and May 26, it said. On some occasions, the Canadian plane had to quickly change course to avoid collision, it added.

40.title: People said Welcome wasn't funny, I was in hospital due to high BP: Anees
40.article_body: Talking about Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Welcome', the film's director Anees Bazmee said, "Nobody liked it after the first...screening. I asked them what they didn't like...and they said, 'It's not funny at all'." "I became stressed about taking the film to the public...[and got hospitalised] because of high blood pressure," added Anees. "We released the film without any changes," stated Anees.

41.title: He's becoming Paigambar: CPI (M) leader on Assam CM's Muslim marriages remark
41.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Hannan Mollah on Thursday criticised Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma for his remark on Muslim marriages. "Assam CM is becoming the Paigambar (religious leader), not Chief Minister. Every day he's giving advice on different religions," he said. Sarma had recently said his government is clear that no Muslim man should marry three women.

42.title: Imran Khan warns of 'civil war' in Pakistan if polls not announced
42.article_body: Pakistan's ousted PM Imran Khan has warned that the country "will go towards [a] civil war" if fresh elections were not announced. He also said that there was "no question" of returning to the National Assembly as that would "mean accepting the conspiracy" that had removed his government. Khan was ousted through a no-trust vote on April 10.

43.title: Aditya is the best companion one could ask for: Yami on her husband
43.article_body: Speaking about her anniversary plans with her husband, filmmaker Aditya Dhar, actress Yami Gautam said, "My mother is in town, Aditya's parents are there...and our entire family is here. So we [will] have a small lunch at home, there will be a small puja." "You feel...happy when you know you're with the best companion you could ask for," she added.

44.title: People were talking about him retiring: Sania on Bopanna reaching French Open semis
44.article_body: Ahead of Rohan Bopanna's men's doubles semi-final match at French Open on Thursday, India's Sania Mirza said she's very happy to see the 42-year-old still playing at the highest level. "I'm so happy to see him play at this level, you know, when people [were] talking about him retiring...[he has] a legit shot at the [doubles] title," stated Mirza.

45.title: Congress councillor held for creating ruckus in Telangana theatre
45.article_body: Police arrested Congress party councillor Jonny Pasha for allegedly creating ruckus inside a theatre in Telangana's Nalgonda. "Jonny Pasha had a fight with three persons in a theatre...When we reached the spot, police tried to stop him but he did not listen and created a ruckus there," said Superintendent of Police, Nalgonda. Three people received minor injuries in the incident.

46.title: Accused entitled to call records at start of trial: Punjab and Haryana HC
46.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has ruled that an accused is entitled to be provided with call records at the beginning of the trial.  The accused has to build up his defence right from the very inception after charges are framed, it added. HC was hearing a plea from a person whose application to provide call records was dismissed.

47.title: Ayan didn't show me Brahmastra but showed to my dad, I'm upset: Rajamouli
47.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli jokingly said he has a complaint against 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji for not showing him the film, despite Rajamouli coming to Mumbai twice after the release of his film 'RRR'. "He showed the entire film to my father [KV Vijayendra Prasad]...(He laughed) I am quite upset with him," added Rajamouli. 'Brahmastra' stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

48.title: AAP leaders visiting Moosewala’s parents discretely: Punjab Congress
48.article_body: The Punjab Congress on Thursday said that the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders have started "shedding crocodile tears" for late singer Sidhu Moosewala by paying a "discrete visit" to his parents, away from the public gaze. "Backdoor condolences!" Punjab Congress tweeted. Furthermore, the party said that the ruling AAP exposed Moosewala like a "sitting duck".

49.title: T'gana suffered extreme 'misgovernance' by TRS in last 8 yrs: Rahul
49.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, on the occasion of Telangana Formation Day, said the state was born out of people's aspirations for a better future. "In the last eight years, Telangana...suffered extreme misgovernance by TRS," Rahul added. He further reaffirmed Congress' commitment to build Telangana into a model state, ensuring prosperity for all, including farmers, poor and common people.

50.title: Old pic shows singer KK and director Kabir Khan on stage during their college days
50.article_body: Actress Mini Mathur, on Thursday, remembered singer KK with a throwback picture. It features the late singer along with Mini's filmmaker-husband Kabir Khan and another friend. Kabir and KK attended college together at Delhi University's Kirori Mal College. "As the world bids KK goodbye, some memories from the dancing as part of the ZEDDs that will always remain," wrote Mini.

51.title: Who is 23-year-old Dr Shagun Batra, the NEET-PG topper?
51.article_body: Dr Shagun Batra secured first rank in the NEET-PG exam, the results of which were declared on Wednesday. The 23-year-old enrolled in Delhi's Maulana Azad Medical College in 2016 and was the gold medallist from her MBBS batch, HT reported. She's an alumna of Delhi Public School (RK Puram) and was the school topper in her Class 12 Board exams.

52.title: China's Geely launches 1st 9 low-orbit satellites for self-driving cars
52.article_body: China-based Zhejiang Geely has launched its first nine low earth orbit satellites to build a satellite network to provide more accurate navigation for autonomous vehicles. Geely expects another 63 GeeSAT-1 satellites to be in orbit by 2025. The satellites have an operating lifespan of five years and will disintegrate in Earth's atmosphere without leaving any space debris.

53.title: Ambulances with hydraulic lifts to come up in Himachal to treat sick animals
53.article_body: Himachal Pradesh government has decided to start a network of veterinary ambulances across the state for treatment of sick and injured animals. Reports said the equipment needed for diagnosis, minor surgery and disease investigation will be installed in the ambulances. State Animal Husbandry Minister said the ambulances will have hydraulic lifts to shift animals to government facilities.

54.title: Over 550 cases of monkeypox reported from 30 countries so far: WHO
54.article_body: Over 550 confirmed cases of monkeypox have been reported from 30 countries that aren't endemic to the virus, World Health Organisation (WHO) said on Wednesday. "Sudden appearance of monkeypox in many countries at the same time suggests there may have been undetected transmission for some time," WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said. Symptoms of monkeypox include rashes, lesions and fever.

55.title: Heartbreaking, mind-numbing: Omar on bank manager’s killing in J&K
55.article_body: After a bank manager from Rajasthan was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's (J&K) Kulgam, ex-J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Thursday said it’s heartbreaking to see families destroyed like this. "Tweeting to condemn an attack and condole a death are becoming a mind-numbingly regular thing," Abdullah said. "Yet another targeted killing!" he added.

56.title: Visually impaired woman raped while trying to find a bus in Delhi
56.article_body: A visually impaired woman, who was trying to find the right bus to go home, was allegedly raped by the man who offered to help her in southwest Delhi, police said on Thursday. Police received information about the crime from a hospital. The accused was arrested and sent to judicial custody based on technical evidence collected from the spot.

57.title: Man who raped woman with sharp object & murdered her sentenced to death in Mumbai
57.article_body: A Mumbai court has sentenced a 45-year-old man to death after convicting him for raping and murdering a 30-year-old woman in Sakinaka in September last year. Convict Mohan Chauhan had raped the woman using a sharp object, following which she succumbed to her injuries. The police had also sought capital punishment for him.

58.title: Rajnath holds bilateral talks with Israeli Defence Minister in Delhi
58.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and his Israeli counterpart Benny Gantz held bilateral talks in Delhi on Thursday. Gantz, who's on a visit to India to mark 30 years of India-Israel diplomatic relations, discussed topics including military cooperation and strategic global challenges with Singh. Gantz also received a Tri-Service Guard of Honour and laid a wreath at the National War Memorial.

59.title: Running companies hurts my heart: World's richest person Elon Musk
59.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "Running companies hurts my heart...but I don't see any other way to bring technology and design to fruition." After a Twitter user recalled Musk being replaced as CEO of X.com in 2000, Musk wrote, "I never wanted to be CEO...Bill Harris sounded like he'd be...great CEO, given his Intuit experience, but he wasn't."

60.title: Can't disclose reasons for security clearance denial to MediaOne TV: Govt
60.article_body: The Centre told the Supreme Court that it cannot disclose its reasons for the denial of security clearance to Malayalam news channel MediaOne TV. Such disclosure will have "unimaginable" and "far-reaching" consequences on national security, it added. SC in March had stayed the order denying security clearance to the channel. Centre had banned the MediaOne TV telecast citing security reasons.

61.title: 6.1-magnitude earthquake hits China; 4 killed, 41 injured
61.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 6.1 struck Ya'an city of China's Sichuan province on Wednesday, which left four people dead and 41 others injured, according to authorities. One of the injured persons is reportedly in critical condition, while 38 suffered minor injuries. A total of 13,081 people in the city are said to have been affected by the earthquake.

62.title: Delhi to replace 'Harijan' with 'Dr Ambedkar' in names of streets, colonies
62.article_body: Delhi Social Welfare Minister RP Gautam on Thursday said the government will soon issue a notification to replace the word 'Harijan' with 'Dr Ambedkar' in names of streets and colonies. Delhi will be one of the first states to curb the word's use, Gautam said. Law department officials have been instructed to complete the process within 10 days, he added.

63.title: 8-yr-old found hanging from window grille in Pune; suicide suspected
63.article_body: An eight-year-old boy was found hanging from a window grille with rope at his home in Pune district's Pimpri-Chinchwad. A doll which was strangled with a rope with its head covered with a cloth was lying next to him. Police said the investigation till now suggests that the boy may have strangled the doll and then hanged himself.

64.title: Govt considers panel to rule on appeals over social media takedowns
64.article_body: The central government is considering setting up an appeals panel that will have the power to reverse the content moderation decisions of social media firms, a document made public on Thursday revealed. It proposed one or more such panels and set a deadline of 30 days for appeals against decisions by company grievance officers.

65.title: TN man buys camel from Rajasthan, uses it to steal sand; booked
65.article_body: Police have booked a 52-year-old man for illegally carrying mined sand using a camel in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga. The accused had bought a male and female camel from Rajasthan with a thought of selling camel milk to residents around the town. But the female camel had a fracture and he couldn't supply milk, so he started smuggling sand, police said.

66.title: Hate speech on FB rises 38%, violent content on Instagram rises 86% in Apr
66.article_body: Facebook witnessed a 37.82% rise in hate speech content while Instagram saw an 86% rise in violent content in April 2022, a report released by their parent firm Meta said. Facebook took action against 53,200 hate speech-related content with a proactive rate of 82.2%. Instagram acted on 77,000 violence and incitement-related content with a proactive rate of 96.7%.

67.title: 3,400-year-old city reemerges from river after drought in Iraq; pics released
67.article_body: A 3,400-year-old city reemerged from a reservoir on the Tigris River after drought in Iraq. A team of archaeologists believed it to be the remnants of a city from the Mittani Kingdom, which ruled the region during the Bronze Age. Earlier this year, the team reportedly found evidence of a large city, including a storage complex, industrial building and fortifications.

68.title: Was a nightmare to face Wasim Akram: Ex-SL captain Mahela Jayawardena
68.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram was the "best" fast bowler he ever faced. "It was a nightmare to face him...because he is challenging you with the new ball, doesn't matter what format it is. He had a really quick-arm action and...the ability to beat you any time of the day," added Jayawardena.

69.title: Pune hospital's employee issues fake disability certificate; booked
69.article_body: An employee of the Sassoon hospital in Pune has been booked for allegedly issuing a fake disability certificate to a person. The action was taken based on a complaint from hospital authorities. The accused worked as a data operator at a department responsible for issuing disability certificates after collecting essential documents from applicants.

70.title: Paul Pogba to leave Manchester United at the end of June
70.article_body: Paul Pogba will leave Manchester United on a free transfer when his contract expires at the end of June. This is the second time Pogba is leaving United for free, the first being in 2012 when he joined Juventus. He returned in 2016 for a then-world-record fee of £89.3 million. Pogba has scored 39 goals in 233 appearances for United.

71.title: Allu Arjun should work with me: Akshay on South films dominating Hindi market
71.article_body: During the promotions of 'Samrat Prithiviraj', actor Akshay Kumar was reportedly asked about South films dominating the Hindi market. He said, "Stop creating...divide and rule kind of scenario in the country. There's nothing called south and north, we all are one as an industry." "Allu Arjun should work with me soon and I'll act with another south actor," he added.

72.title: UPI transactions cross ₹10-lakh-crore mark for the first time in May
72.article_body: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) saw transactions worth ₹10.41 lakh crore in May 2022, crossing the ₹10-lakh-crore mark for the first time ever, data from National Payments Corporation of India showed. A total of 595 crore transactions were recorded in May 2022, up 134.5% from 254 crore transactions recorded in May 2021. UPI transactions also breached the $1-trillion mark in FY22.

73.title: Conspiracy theorist: Smriti on Kejriwal's 'Sisodia to be arrested' claim
73.article_body: Soon after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said as per reliable sources AAP's Manish Sisodia is going to be arrested soon in "fake cases", Union Minister Smriti Irani tweeted, "Conspiracy theorist strikes back!" "It would be easier to come out ‘clean’ for once instead of peddling fake sob stories which do not have any takers anymore," Irani tweeted.

74.title: 3-yr-old dies of encephalitis in Muzaffarpur, toll reaches 4 in Bihar
74.article_body: A three-year-old girl, Shivani Kumari, died of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in Bihar's Muzaffarpur. With this, total number of deaths due to Japanese Encephalitis (JE) and AES, a cluster of brain-related diseases, has gone up to four this year. Shivani was admitted to hospital on May 31 and died on the same day, pointing to a delay in getting hospitalised.

75.title: Govt relaxes educational criteria for Chhattisgarh tribals to join CRPF
75.article_body: Union Cabinet on Wednesday relaxed eligibility criteria for tribals from Chhattisgarh to join the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF). As per the guidelines, the educational requirement for Constable (General Duty) has been relaxed from Class 10 to Class 8 for native tribal youths of Bijapur, Dantewada and Sukma. With this, 400 tribal youths will get employment opportunities, the government said.

76.title: Depp spotted in UK pub moments before winning $15 mn in defamation trial, pic surfaces
76.article_body: Johnny Depp was spotted in a UK pub moments before winning a defamation lawsuit against Amber Heard. In another video, Depp was seen leaving the pub shortly before the verdict. Depp was awarded $15 million by the court. The actor had sued Heard over a 2018 op-ed in which she described herself as "a public figure representing domestic abuse".

77.title: Shreyas Iyer buys Mercedes-Benz G 63 for over ₹2.45 crore, pic surfaces
77.article_body: Team India batter and KKR captain Shreyas Iyer bought Mercedes-Benz G 63 for over ₹2.45 crore. Iyer also owns a Lamborghini and an Audi S5, as per reports. Iyer bought the Mercedes following the conclusion of IPL 2022, in which he scored 401 runs in 14 innings. KKR had finished seventh on the points table.

78.title: Data operator at Pune hospital issues fake disability certificate; booked
78.article_body: Police have booked a data operator at Pune's Sassoon hospital for allegedly issuing a fake disability certificate to a person. The operator was booked following a complaint from the hospital authorities. Police suspect that the accused issued the certificate in exchange for money. The suspect has been booked under sections 417, 465, 466, and 468 of the Indian Penal Code.

79.title: World's top 10 neglected refugee crises all in Africa: Report
79.article_body: In a first, 10 African nations have topped a list comprising of countries with world's 'most neglected' displacement crises, according to Norwegian Refugee Council's annual report. The Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) has topped list for a second time, followed by Burkina Faso, Cameroon and South Sudan. Chad, Mali, Sudan, Nigeria, Burundi and Ethiopia are other countries on list.

80.title: CCTV footage of terrorist firing at bank manager in Kashmir surfaces
80.article_body: A CCTV footage of the terrorist attack on bank manager Vijay Kumar in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam has surfaced online. The video shows the terrorist in face mask peeking inside the bank and appearing to leave before he barges into the building once again and shoots at Kumar. Police said Vijay Kumar was a resident of Hanumangarh in Rajasthan.

81.title: Don't call me for statements on KK, can't talk about him in past tense: Vishal
81.article_body: Singer Vishal Dadlani took to Twitter to request media to stop calling him for statements on late singer KK. "I can't speak about him in the past tense...I simply don't have the strength," Vishal wrote. "The tears won't stop. What a guy he was. What a voice...what a heart, what a human being. KK is forever!!!" he had earlier tweeted.

82.title: Sidhu Moosewala's family writes to Amit Shah, seeks investigation by central agency
82.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's family has written to Union Home Minister Amit Shah for a probe by a central agency into the singer's murder, Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said. Shekhawat recently met the family of Moosewala, who was also a Congress leader. Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

83.title: A new face stepped up in every match: Shami on GT's IPL 2022 win
83.article_body: GT pacer Mohammad Shami said a new face stepped up in most of their games in IPL 2022, helping them win the title in their inaugural season. "For every team, their senior players...[performed]. But for Gujarat...new [faces stepped] up," stated Shami. "The bonding that we formed right from day one has been managed really well by the management," he added.

84.title: Man looking for frisbees in a lake killed by alligator in US
84.article_body: A man looking for frisbees in the water along a lakeshore in US' Florida was allegedly killed by an alligator, officials said, adding that there were posted signs of no swimming in the lake. The man's corpse, with one arm ripped off, was discovered on Tuesday morning. This was reportedly the first fatal alligator attack in Florida since 2019.

85.title: UP CM Yogi makes 'Samrat Prithviraj' tax-free after watching it with cabinet
85.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Thursday announced that actor Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' will be tax-free in the state. He watched the movie with his cabinet colleagues at a special screening at the Raj Bhawan. Adityanath added that the decision to make the movie tax-free was taken so that a common man can also watch this movie.

86.title: Pakistan will break in 3 parts if right decisions not made: Imran
86.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan said that the country will be broken into three parts if the government does not make the right decisions. "If the establishment does not take the right decision, then…they will be destroyed and the armed forces will be the first ones to be devastated," he said during a TV interview.

87.title: 2 brothers of ex-BJP MLA shot dead in Patna
87.article_body: Two brothers of former BJP MLA Chitranjan Kumar were shot dead in Patna on Tuesday. The two - Shambhu Sharan (32) and Gautam Singh (28) - were returning home from office on a bike, when some motorcycle-borne perpetrators opened fire on them, said police. "An FIR has been lodged against seven persons. All belong to a rival gang," said police.

88.title: Singer KK cremated in Mumbai, son Nakul performs last rites
88.article_body: Singer KK, who passed away at the age of 53 in Kolkata on Tuesday, was cremated at the Versova Hindu Cemetery in Mumbai's Andheri on Thursday. KK's son Nakul performed his father's last rites. KK passed away due to a suspected cardiac arrest after performing at a concert in Kolkata.

89.title: Amazon to shut Kindle e-bookstore in China in 2023
89.article_body: Amazon will shut its Kindle e-bookstore in China in 2023 and will stop supplying retailers with Kindle e-readers, starting today. The Kindle e-bookstore will stop selling ebooks from June 30, 2023. However, customers will be able to continue downloading any purchased books for a year beyond that. The Kindle app will also be removed from Chinese app stores in 2024.

90.title: IIT Guwahati develops device to turn wastewater into energy
90.article_body: Researchers at IIT Guwahati have developed a bio-electrochemical device, Microbial Fuel Cell (MFC) that generates green energy by treating wastewater. MFC is an eco-friendly device that offers dual benefit of bioelectricity generation and waste management. "After scaling the process, it can be used as a source of clean energy using municipal wastewater...economically," Director, IIT Guwahati said.

91.title: Liquor, bhang shops near Sri Krishna Janmabhoomi in Mathura shut down
91.article_body:
To comply with the ban imposed on liquor vends in areas declared as 'teerth' by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, the district Excise Office on Wednesday shut down about 29 shops 
selling liquor, beer and 'bhang' in the vicinity of Sri Krishna Janmabhoomi in Mathura. Reports said that meat shops had already been closed in the area.

92.title: 1 dead, 2 missing after boat capsizes in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa
92.article_body: A 19-year-old man died after a rowboat with six people on board capsized in Tamas river in Rewa district of Madhya Pradesh. While three people swam to safety, two others went missing, reports added. The incident occurred on Wednesday noon when the boat was on its way to Gurguda village from Hardahan village, said Superintendent of Police, Navneet Bhasin.

93.title: Assam govt very clear that no Muslim man should marry 3 women: CM
93.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said the state government is very clear about certain things like no Muslim man should marry three women. "Don’t give talaq, give divorce legally. An equal share of the property should be given to daughters like sons," Sarma added. "Views of the government and the common Muslims are the same," Sarma stated.

94.title: Playing in the same team as Symonds made you feel bulletproof: Watson
94.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said playing in the same team as late Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds made one feel "bulletproof". "He was so...incredibly good," added Watson. "Symonds was very much Viv Richards reincarnated in the way he played," he stated. "He always thought spin was there just to be smashed out of the ground," said Watson.

95.title: It’s our duty to watch film on Savarkar: Shiv Sena leader
95.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming movie 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar', Shiv Sena leader Bharatshet Gogawale said Veer Savarkar is the pride of our nation and his work is legendary. "I feel it's our duty to watch a film that praised him and his work," Gogawale added. "A film on Savarkar is an excellent thing for all Hindus in this country," he stated.

96.title: SRPF jawan shoots colleague dead, kills self in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli
96.article_body: A 35-year-old State Reserve Police Force (SRPF) jawan, identified as Shrikant Berad, allegedly shot his 33-year-old colleague dead before killing himself with his service rifle in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district, police said. The incident took place on Wednesday at Marpalli police post in Aheri tehsil, police added. The motive behind the incident is being ascertained, police further said.

97.title: KK had heart blockages, excitement during concert led to cardiac arrest: Doctor
97.article_body: KK, who passed away on Tuesday following a concert, had heart blockages, a doctor who conducted autopsy told PTI. "He had a major blockage in the left main coronary artery and small blockages in various other arteries and sub-arteries. Excessive excitement during the live show caused stoppage of blood flow leading to cardiac arrest that claimed his life," he stated.

98.title: Double-decker bus turned into classroom at govt school in Kerala
98.article_body: A double-decker bus belonging to Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) has been converted into a high-tech classroom and a place for recreation for students at the Manacaud Government Lower Primary School. It is equipped with TV, air-conditioner, chairs with multi-coloured tables, benches and shelves for books. Its steering wheel and driver's seat have been retained to let children play.

99.title: McCullum messaged me asking if I was in: Moeen on Test cricket comeback
99.article_body: England all-rounder Moeen Ali, who announced retirement from Test cricket last year, has revealed that England's newly-appointed Test coach Brendon McCullum has asked him if he would be available to play Tests again in future. "We spoke...[he asked] would I be available [in the future]? I said, 'Call me at the time'. We'll see...The door is open," stated Moeen.

100.title: Man sends child porn videos to women on FB, arrested by B'luru police
100.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested a 40-year-old food delivery executive for allegedly sharing child pornographic material with women on Facebook. Purushotham was arrested after a report was shared by the National Crime Records Bureau. Purushotham used to randomly send friend requests to women on Facebook and after they accepted his request he'd send obscene photos and videos of children, police said.

101.title: Manish Sisodia gets portfolios allocated to Satyendar Jain after his arrest
101.article_body: After Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested by Enforcement Directorate in an alleged money laundering case, portfolios allocated to him have now been handed over to Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia. Meanwhile, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that after Jain, Sisodia is likely to be arrested too and "Centre has ordered agencies to form fake cases against him".

102.title: Sonia Gandhi tests COVID-19 +ve before ED appearance in money laundering case
102.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has tested positive for COVID-19. Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said, "She has developed mild fever and some symptoms and has isolated herself." He added, "As of today, her date of appearance before the Enforcement Directorate on June 8 stands as it is." The ED summoned Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi in an alleged money laundering case.

103.title: Kamal Haasan watches as Vikram trailer plays on Burj Khalifa, video surfaces
103.article_body: In a video shared online, actor Kamal Haasan can be seen standing and watching as the trailer of his movie 'Vikram' plays on Burj Khalifa. In the video, photographers can be seen clicking Haasan's pictures. People cheering from behind the camera can also be heard in the video. Haasan can also be seen smiling and talking to someone.

104.title: Workers, not politicians' children, will get preference in polls: Nadda
104.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Wednesday said the party will give preference to workers over children or family members of politicians in upcoming polls. "In Uttar Pradesh...children of many lawmakers were competent. Similar may be the case in MP. But we have to follow a policy," Nadda said. "We are against politics of dynasty," he added.

105.title: Had belief that I'm thinking them into victory: SRK on KKR's IPL title wins
105.article_body: Discussing KKR's IPL title wins in 2012 and 2014, the team's co-owner Shah Rukh Khan said, "I had this belief that I am thinking my team into victory...Both times it has happened that it goes numb!" Talking about KKR's win in the IPL 2014 final, KKR pacer Umesh Yadav said, "After Piyush Chawla scored that winning shot, there was...mayhem."

106.title: 2 labourers die as soil collapses at construction site in Gurugram
106.article_body: At least two labourers died after soil collapsed on them at an under-construction plot in Gurugram's Sector 57 on Wednesday, police said. "The basement had been dug over 10 feet below the ground level...labourers were putting pillars...when a mound of soil collapsed on them...they were trapped underneath," police added. It took over 15 minutes to retrieve their bodies, police stated.

107.title: Jinnah, Nehru divided country as act of wisdom: Congress leader
107.article_body: Congress leader Sajjan Singh Verma said that Muhammad Ali Jinnah and ex-PM Jawaharlal Nehru "divided the country as an act of wisdom". "Jinnah was a freedom fighter and this should be remembered. He did not break the country but did the right thing," he added. "Does the definition of freedom fighter change because of one being a Muslim?" he stated.

108.title: 30-yr-old man kidnaps college student at gunpoint in Gurugram; arrested
108.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping a female college student at gunpoint in Gurugram. According to police, the incident took place on Tuesday, when the victim was waiting for an auto-rickshaw outside her college. "When the accused saw...police chasing him, he dropped the victim at the Rampura flyover and escaped," said Civil Lines SHO Pankaj Kumar.

109.title: Former Congress leader Hardik Patel joins BJP
109.article_body: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel, who recently quit Congress, joined BJP on Thursday. Before joining BJP, Patel tweeted, "I will work as a small soldier under the leadership of the PM Narendra Modi." He added, "With the feelings of national interest, state interest, public interest and social interest, I am going to start a new chapter from today."

110.title: Vistara pilot lands plane without proper training, airline fined ₹10 lakh
110.article_body: Aviation regulator DGCA has imposed ₹10 lakh as fine on Vistara for letting an improperly trained pilot land an aircraft with passengers on board at the Indore airport. The pilot, who was the first officer, landed the aircraft without getting the requisite training in a simulator. "This was a serious violation endangering lives of the passengers on board," officials said.

111.title: Our history books filled with info on invaders, only 2-3 lines on our own kings: Akshay
111.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that history books in India are filled with information on invaders, adding that there are just two to three lines about our own kings. He added, "I'd like to appeal to Education Minister to look into this matter and see if we can balance it. We should know about Mughals, but know about our kings too."

112.title: UP govt official suspended over 'best junior engineer' pic of Osama bin Laden in office
112.article_body: Ravindra Prakash Gautam, sub-divisional officer (SDO) with the Dakshinanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam Ltd (DVVNL), has been suspended after he placed a picture of Osama bin Laden in his office in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad district. A note below the picture read, "Respected Osama bin Laden, world's best junior engineer." The picture has been removed from his office, officials said.

113.title: Video shows toxic foam floating on surface of Yamuna river in Delhi
113.article_body: A layer of toxic foam was seen floating on the surface of the Yamuna river at ITO in Delhi. A video showing white coloured foam floating on the river has also reportedly gone viral on social media. Meanwhile, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that his government is aiming to treat all wastewater before it's discharged into Yamuna.

114.title: Request PM to jail all AAP MLAs at once, not 1 at a time: Kejriwal
114.article_body: Days after Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's arrest, CM Arvind Kejriwal, in an apparent dig, asked PM Narendra Modi to jail all ministers and MLAs from AAP at one go. "Ask all central agencies to do all investigations at one go…Do as many raids as you want. You arrest one minister at a time, it obstructs public work," said Kejriwal.

115.title: Knew we'll hit the least sixes but we hit the most fours: GT's Kirsten
115.article_body: GT batting coach Gary Kirsten said they realised they were the team who were going to hit the least sixes in IPL 2022, but they hit the most fours. "We faced the least dot balls in...[IPL 2022]," added Kirsten. "From a bowling perspective, we knew we wanted to be the...best in the powerplay and best at the death," stated Kirsten.

116.title: Former Colombian drug lord 'Chess Player' dies in US prison
116.article_body: Gilberto Orejuela, the former leader of Colombia's drug trafficking Cali Cartel, died of lymphoma in a US prison while serving a 30-year drug trafficking sentence, his family said on Wednesday. Nicknamed 'The Chess Player', Orejuela was considered to be one of the world's biggest drug lords after Pablo Escobar's death in 1993. He was extradited to the US in 2004.

117.title: Bank manager from Rajasthan shot dead in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam
117.article_body: A bank manager named Vijay Kumar from Rajasthan was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam, South Kashmir. Police said that Kumar was the bank manager at Ellaquai Dehati Bank in Kulgam district and was a resident of Hanumangarh in Rajasthan. This comes just two days after a teacher named Rajni Bala was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam.

118.title: Hardik's captaincy a real lesson for many other captains: Gary Kirsten
118.article_body: GT mentor Gary Kirsten has said Hardik Pandya's captaincy in IPL 2022 was a "real lesson" for many other captains. "His captaincy was beautiful to watch...He never chased the spotlight and the profile that comes with captaincy," added Kirsten. "He remained Hardik the person, easy to talk to, always asking questions about how he can improve," he further said.

119.title: We will only have 1 Cristiano: Carlos on picking Ronaldo over Messi
119.article_body: Talking about picking Cristiano Ronaldo over Lionel Messi in his ultimate Champions League XI, ex-Real Madrid defender Roberto Carlos said, "Cristiano represents exactly what the Champions League is and modern football." "We will only have one Cristiano," added Carlos. Cristiano has won the Champions League five times so far. Messi won all four of his Champions League titles with Barcelona.

120.title: Kolkata killed KK: Om Puri's ex-wife Nandita Puri
120.article_body: Late actor Om Puri's former wife Nandita Puri on Wednesday said that Kolkata administration killed singer KK. She wrote, "With a crowd of 7k for a 2.5k capacity, failed air conditioning; the singer perspiring profusely complained 4 times to no avail." This comes after reports claimed that KK was seen uncomfortable during his live performance due to heat and crowd.

121.title: 24-year-old woman in Gujarat to marry herself, says 'Want to portray that women matter'
121.article_body: A 24-year-old woman named Kshama Bindu will get married to herself on June 11 in Gujarat's Vadodara. "Maybe I am the first to set an example of self-love in our country...but what I am actually trying to portray is that women matter," she said. She further said that her parents are open-minded and accepting of her wedding.

122.title: Gulzar picked me up to play tennis, we met daily in shorts: Neena to trolls
122.article_body: While speaking about trolls who mocked her for meeting poet Gulzar while wearing shorts, actress Neena Gupta said that she and Gulzar became friends when he used to pick her up every morning to play tennis. "I would like to educate some trolls...we were always in shorts when we met each other everyday," she added.

123.title: Dhoni told me to pull my length back: Prashant on his maiden IPL wicket
123.article_body: CSK leg-spinner Prashant Solanki has revealed how captain MS Dhoni helped him to get his maiden IPL wicket against RR in IPL 2022. "I was hit for a six off my first ball. Then (Dhoni) gave me an indication that I have to pull my length back...Let [Yashasvi] play strokes on the bigger end. Then I was successful," stated Solanki.

124.title: 1 dead, 1 critical after shots fired following clash outside college in Amritsar
124.article_body: A 24-year-old man died and another is in critical condition after gunshots were fired outside Khalsa College in Punjab's Amritsar on Wednesday, police said. "Shots were fired during the clash between two groups outside the college...It was a routine crime, not a gang war," police added. The victims were shot at by two armed assailants on a two-wheeler, police stated.

125.title: 2 lakh children forcefully taken from Ukraine to Russia: Zelenskyy
125.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said more than 2,00,000 children are among the Ukrainians who have been forcefully taken to Russia and dispersed across the vast country. "The purpose of this criminal policy is not just to steal people but to make deportees forget about Ukraine...not be able to return," he added. Ukraine will punish those responsible, Zelenskyy said.

126.title: Djokovic handles his anger better than anyone I've ever seen: McEnroe
126.article_body: Ex-world number one tennis player John McEnroe said Novak Djokovic has found a way out of difficult situations more than any other player in the history of tennis. "He's so mentally strong," added McEnroe. McEnroe stated that Djokovic handles his anger and frustration better than anyone he has ever seen. "I didn't do it as well," he said.

127.title: B'luru-based Cuemath raises $57 million at $407 million valuation
127.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Cuemath has raised $57 million in a funding round led by Alpha Wave at a $407 million valuation. The round saw participation from all of Cuemath's existing investors, including Lightrock India, Sequoia Capital India, Alphabet's independent growth fund CapitalG, Manta Ray and Unitus. Cuemath offers an after-school online math program for K-12 students.

128.title: After Satyendar Jain, Manish Sisodia to be arrested soon in fake cases: Kejriwal
128.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said in a press conference, "Reliable sources have suggested to me that Manish Sisodia is going to be arrested soon. Centre has ordered all agencies to form fake cases against him." He added, "I'd already announced a few months back that central government is going to arrest Satyendar Jain in a fake case."

129.title: Love you forever dad: KK's daughter Taamara ahead of his funeral
129.article_body: Late singer KK’s daughter Taamara took to Instagram to share details about his funeral today. On her Instagram Stories, she wrote, “Love you forever dad," and added a heart emoticon. KK passed away after a concert in Kolkata on Tuesday. KK passed away due to a suspected cardiac arrest, as per the preliminary post-mortem report.

130.title: No minister of ruling AAP visited Moosewala’s family: Congress leader
130.article_body: Days after Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead, Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa on Wednesday said that no MP or minister of the ruling AAP visited the singer’s house and stood by the family. "CM Bhagwant Mann Ji is this what you meant when you said 'Our government will be for aam aadmi?'" Bajwa tweeted.

131.title: Why Kejriwal didn't take action against Satyendar Jain: Smriti Irani
131.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani asked why Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal didn't take any action against Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain, who has been arrested in an alleged money laundering case. "For how long he will protect a desh ka gaddar (traitor), who...deceived the treasury," Irani said. She also asked if Kejriwal was associated with Jain, "who...laundered  ₹16.39 crore through shell companies".

132.title: Police arrest 28-yr-old drug peddler in Hyderabad, seize 30 kg ganja
132.article_body: Police on Wednesday arrested a 28-year-old drug peddler, identified as Lavudya Ganesh, in Hyderabad and seized 30 kilograms of contraband ganja from his possession. The officials also seized a bike and one mobile phone all worth ₹8.25 lakh. Ganesh purchased the ganja from Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam and transported it to Hyderabad and Kamareddy district for selling, police added.

133.title: Delhi HC fines firm ₹12 cr, orders money to be used for smog tower
133.article_body: Delhi High Court on Wednesday imposed a penalty of ₹12.5 crore on a private company for concealing facts. While taking note of air pollution in Delhi, the court ordered the money to be utilised for installation of a smog tower in the city. It further directed the Registrar General to ensure that the tower is installed and operationalised before winter.

134.title: They broke tables, seemed animals took over: Kirron on AAP in house meeting
134.article_body: While talking about Aam Aadmi Party councillors during a press conference, BJP MP and actress Kirron Kher said that they created pandemonium in the very first House meeting after the MC elections. "They were breaking tables and glasses. I have never seen such junglipana. It appeared animals had taken over," she said, adding it seemed women councillors would hit them.

135.title: McCullum is all about making everyone feel '10 feet tall', it's been good: Stokes
135.article_body: Ahead of their first Test against New Zealand, England Test captain Ben Stokes has said it's been "good" working with their newly-appointed Test coach Brendon McCullum. Stokes stated, "McCullum has been good. [He] is all about making everyone feel, in his words, '10 feet tall'." England's first Test against New Zealand will be McCullum's first game as their coach.

136.title: PM Modi's support to Sri Lanka's Rajapaksas was wrong: AIADMK
136.article_body: AIADMK organisational secretary C Ponnaiyan has criticised the BJP-led Centre, calling its policies "anti-Tamil". He also questioned the Centre's support to Sri Lanka's Rajapaksa family. "[PM] Narendra Modi government's support to Rajapaksas was wrong. India should have been supporting Sri Lankan Tamils instead," said Ponnaiyan. He also accused the Centre of stealing Tamil Nadu's revenue.

137.title: Me, Rajinikanth got our style from him: Kamal Haasan on K Balachander
137.article_body: Kamal Haasan said his and Rajinikanth's style as actors came from late filmmaker and Dadasaheb Phalke award winner K Balachander. "I have done 36 films with K Balachander (KB) and that's my PhD. I learned it all from him. KB garu was a fantastic actor," added Haasan. Haasan's upcoming film 'Vikram' has reportedly earned over ₹200 crore before its release.

138.title: Money laundering without money: Chidambaram on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul
138.article_body: As ED summoned Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, party leader P Chidambaram said money laundering without money is like alleging purse snatching without a purse. “It’s like alleging that you were found swimming without authorisation in pool that had no water,” Chidambaram tweeted. “You can think of more examples (each one more absurd than the other),” Chidambaram added.

139.title: Father Stan Swamy to be honoured by Geneva rights foundation
139.article_body: Tribal rights activist Father Stan Swamy, who died last year after being jailed in Bhima Koregaon case, will get a "special, posthumous homage" at the Martin Ennals Award in Geneva on Thursday. The jury wished to highlight Father Stan's contributions to human rights, "which cannot be eclipsed by his unjust incarceration by Indian authorities," said Chair of the Award Jury.

140.title: My deepest hope is they reconcile: Jada Smith on husband Will hitting Chris Rock
140.article_body: Jada Pinkett Smith has spoken about the Oscars incident when her husband, Will Smith, slapped comedian Chris Rock, saying, "My deepest hope is these two intelligent, capable men have an opportunity to heal, talk this out, and reconcile." She added, "The state of the world today, we need them both, and we all actually need one another more than ever."

141.title: US may sell drones that can be armed with missiles to Ukraine: Report
141.article_body: The US government plans to sell four MQ-1C Gray Eagle drones that can be armed with Hellfire missiles to Ukraine to use against Russia, Reuters reported citing sources. The administration intends to notify the US Congress of the potential sale to Ukraine in the coming days. The sale could still be blocked by Congress.

142.title: Andhra CM launches mobile app to register corruption-related complaints
142.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Wednesday launched the 'ACB 14400' app for people to register corruption-related complaints against officials in the state. "The government, right from its inception has been stressing on...no corruption," Reddy said. The app, developed by Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), will let people record audio, video and photo evidence while registering a complaint.

143.title: Video shows KK saying 'Mar jaaun yahin pe' while praising crowd at last concert
143.article_body: A video of singer KK saying "Haaye, mar jaaun yahin pe (Oh, I could die here)" while praising crowd as they sang 'Aankhon Mein Teri' along with him has surfaced online. KK passed away at the age of 53 after his concert in Kolkata on Tuesday. The singer died of a suspected cardiac arrest.

144.title: Portrait of Queen Elizabeth II released ahead of her Platinum Jubilee
144.article_body: An official photograph of UK's Queen Elizabeth II has been released ahead of celebrations to mark her Platinum Jubilee. The portrait was taken by a window in Victoria Vestibule at Windsor Castle. The 96-year-old, who's the first British monarch to reign for 70 years, thanked people for organising events to celebrate her milestone, saying "many happy memories" would be created.

145.title: Several problems will be solved if PM Modi drops his ego: Sanjay Raut
145.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that several problems in the country will be solved if PM Narendra Modi drops his ego. "If the ego is set aside, then many issues plaguing society...will be solved. Someone should convey this to PM," he added. "Only one message of Gautam Buddha should be kept in mind...that is to leave ego," Raut stated.

146.title: Discrimination against Northeast students down due to PM Modi: Assam CM
146.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Wednesday said that discrimination against the students of Northeast India has reduced due to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's outreach. "If you look at the last 2-3 years, because of PM Modi's outreach to the northeast now racial discrimination against students of the northeast has suddenly gone down to a huge extent," he said.

147.title: UN peacekeeping convoy attacked in Mali; 1 killed, 3 injured
147.article_body: A UN peacekeeper was killed and three others were injured after their convoy came under fire in Mali on Wednesday. The firing lasted for about an hour by suspected terrorists who used small arms and rocket launchers, said a UN spokesperson. UN chief Antonio Guterres condemned the attack and offered condolences to the families of the victims, all Jordanians.

148.title: It's nothing but exploitation: SC on ₹9,000 salary of Odisha home guards
148.article_body: Commenting on ₹9,000 monthly salary of Odisha home guards, Supreme Court said it is nothing but exploitation. "How a home guard can survive...maintain his family on payment of ₹9,000 per month only...he is performing almost the same duties as other police personnel," SC said. SC asked Odisha government to reconsider its decision of paying ₹9,000 monthly only to home guards.

149.title: Temples got submerged but Raj uncle told us to shoot 'Satyam...' ending: Aditya
149.article_body: Actor Aditya Raj Kapoor said that his uncle and late actor Raj Kapoor told the team to "get a camera" and shoot the ending of the film 'Satyam Shivam Sundaram: Love Sublime' while the river water flooded the land and the temples got submerged. Aditya also said he did not meet Raj Kapoor for months after deciding to quit films.

150.title: As I look back at IPL 2022, I know deep down how much it has hurt: Pollard
150.article_body: MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard has shared a post on Instagram over MI's performance in IPL 2022, stating that he knows "deep down" how much it has hurt the fans. "But it didn't derail the spirit, determination and hard work that was put in by every single person. We definitely learnt a lot from this 2022 season," he added.

151.title: Police avert alleged mass sacrifice of goats in Vadodara; 5 booked
151.article_body: Five people were booked after police rescued around 20 goats from an alleged mass sacrifice in Vadodara on Tuesday. An organisation called People for Animals approached police with a tip-off about mass sacrifice, following which police accompanied by them raided the spot. People gathered to perform the superstitious ritual, however, managed to escape with around 15 of the rescued goats.

152.title: 3,712 new COVID-19 cases in India, 35% higher than yesterday
152.article_body: India has reported 3,712 COVID-19 cases, 2,584 recoveries and 5 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,745 COVID-19 cases and 6 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 19,509, while the death toll reached 5,24,641.

153.title: Gunman kills 4 before shooting himself at hospital in US
153.article_body: A man armed with a rifle and a handgun killed four people inside a medical building on a hospital campus in Tulsa, Oklahoma before fatally shooting himself, police said. Multiple injuries had also been confirmed, officials said. Police added that they were trying to determine the suspect's identity, who they estimated was aged between 35 and 40.

154.title: Amber issues statement after losing Depp's defamation trial, says 'I'm heartbroken'
154.article_body: Amber Heard, in a statement issued after she lost Johnny Depp's defamation trial, said, "I'm heartbroken that the mountain of evidence...wasn't enough to stand up to the disproportionate power...and sway of my ex-husband." Calling it a "setback", Amber added, "I'm sadder...that I seem to have lost a right I thought I had as an American- to speak freely and openly."

155.title: Why was Amber Heard awarded $2 million in defamation suit against Johnny Depp?
155.article_body: Amber Heard lost defamation trial after being sued by ex-husband Johnny Depp, but she received a compensatory $2 million in damages. Heard's $2 million came from her countersuit against Depp. The jurors rejected two of Heard's three counterclaims. They concluded she was defamed when Depp's attorney told media that Heard staged property damage to show to police after alleged fight.

156.title: 'Chaliye Hukum', Amit Shah jokingly tells wife Sonal after special screening of film
156.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah and his family watched Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' at a special screening in Delhi on Wednesday. At the end of his speech, he began walking towards the exit but his wife Sonal remained standing, when the minister jokingly said, "Chaliye Hukum." Shah said he watched a film in theatre with his family after 13 years.

157.title: COVID-19 situation getting worse in North Korea: WHO
157.article_body: The WHO has said that they believe the COVID-19 situation in North Korea is "getting worse, not better". This comes even as the country reported less than 1 lakh new "fever" cases for a third consecutive day. The WHO, however, added that it was not in a position to make an adequate risk assessment of the situation on the ground.

158.title: She taught me how to run a company: Zuckerberg as Sandberg resigns as Meta COO
158.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg penned a note after Sheryl Sandberg stepped down as Meta COO after 14 years. "When Sheryl joined me in 2008...I was only 23 and I barely knew anything about running a company," he wrote. "Sheryl architected our ads business, hired great people, forged our management culture, and taught me how to run a company," he added.

159.title: Cong leader demands reopening of Hyderabad's Charminar for prayers
159.article_body: Telangana Congress leader Rashid Khan has started a signature campaign demanding the reopening of Hyderabad's Charminar for offering prayers. Prayers were earlier held, however, Muslims were debarred from offering prayers at the site two decades ago, he claimed. This comes amid the ongoing row over the restoration of an alleged temple complex on the Qutub Minar premises in Delhi.

160.title: Police take road accident victim to hospital in garbage van in Jodhpur, probe ordered
160.article_body: Police used a garbage van on Wednesday to take the body of a man to a hospital after he came under a bus in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. A probe has been ordered into it after a video of the incident surfaced on social media. "The victim was crushed under the wheels of the bus and died on the spot," police said.

161.title: 22-yr-old man killed for refusing to give beer bottles in Delhi, 3 held
161.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death by three men after he refused to give his beer bottles to them in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar, police said. The accused were nabbed after we conducted raids, DCP (North-West) Usha Rangnani added. The accused were in front of a mall after spending all their money and saw the victim carrying beer bottles.

162.title: The word 'Pan-India' is abused, sounds like euphemism for dubbed film: Adivi
162.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh who will play the role of martyr Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan in his next film 'Major', said the word 'pan-India' has been abused, adding that it sounds like a "euphemism" for a dubbed film. "It sounded good in the beginning," added Adivi. Talking about 'Major', Adivi stated every scene was shot, wrote and designed in Hindi.

163.title: Told Bobby of dream to work with him, did song step in front of him: Esha
163.article_body: Talking about Bobby Deol, actress Esha Gupta said, "I...[danced] to 'Duniya Haseenon Ka Mela' at...parties...I told him about me dancing to his [song] and...did the step in front of him." Esha stated that Bobby laughed a lot, adding she shared her childhood dream of working with him. "I...[grew] up watching 'Gupt'...I wasn't old enough to understand...it's a crush," said Esha.

164.title: Lost 30 kg, my mom asked 'Why're you killing yourself': Randeep on Sarbjit
164.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda said he lost 30 kilos while preparing for 'Sarbjit'. He added that his mother, who was staying with him, left and asked why he was killing himself. "She said I can't see you do this...She tried to stop me...She would make things that I like," Randeep said, adding that his mother said she "can't take it anymore".

165.title: I'm not assessing my performances at all, just enjoying my game: Ashwin
165.article_body: Opening up on his recent performances, India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said he's in a "very good space of mind" and "just enjoying" his game. "I'm not in that phase of my life where I'm thinking about what happened," added Ashwin. "The last two years have been hard on a lot of people but...kind and good to me," he further said.

166.title: BJP loves to weaponise pain of Kashmiri Pandits: PDP
166.article_body: The BJP loves to weaponise the pain of the Kashmiri Pandits, said the PDP in its monthly newsletter 'Speak Up' on Tuesday. Referring to the recent killing of a government official, Rahul Bhat, the article titled 'The Saffron Trojan Horse' said, "Kashmiri Pandits get teargassed by the police for protesting [against] the killing of Rahul Bhat."

167.title: Congress will come down to 30-35 seats in 2024 polls: Assam CM
167.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Wednesday said that it will be difficult for the Congress party to retain the status of the principal Opposition party in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "As per my assessment, they will come down to around 30-35 seats in 2024," Sarma added. Furthermore, Sarma said that the party treats all states with contempt.

168.title: Will work as small soldier under PM Modi: Hardik Patel ahead of joining BJP
168.article_body: Ahead of joining BJP on Thursday, Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel said he is going to start a new chapter in his life with the feelings of national, state, public and social interests. "I will work as a small soldier in the noble service of the nation under the successful leadership of PM Narendra Modi," Patel tweeted.

169.title: Man offered lift in SUV; robbed of phone on Pune-Mumbai Expressway
169.article_body: Two people were arrested on Wednesday for allegedly robbing a 32-year-old engineer of his mobile phone on Pune-Mumbai Expressway after offering him a lift. The accused had offered to drop the victim at Khopoli in exchange for money. After travelling a distance, the two threatened to kill him and snatched his mobile phone and dropped him near Talegaon Dabhade.

170.title: 3 soldiers injured in blast in J&K's Shopian: Kashmir Zone Police
170.article_body: Three soldiers were injured in a blast that occurred inside a private hired vehicle in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, the police said on Thursday. The soldiers have been taken to a hospital for treatment, Kashmir Zone Police said in a tweet. The nature and source of the blast - grenade, IED or battery malfunction - is being investigated, it added.

171.title: 3 of family die after falling into septic tank in Haryana
171.article_body: Three members of a family reportedly died after falling into a 20-foot-deep septic tank in Haryana's Bichhor village on Tuesday. According to police, an eight-year-old boy fell into the tank while playing around. His father jumped into the tank to save him, followed by the man's older brother. They lost consciousness after inhaling poisonous gas and died, police said.

172.title: Man throws acid on colleague after fight in Bengaluru; arrested
172.article_body: A 30-year-old jewellery shop employee has been arrested for allegedly throwing acid at his colleague after a fight over a petty issue in Bengaluru. The incident reportedly took place when both the men went out to drink after work with two other friends. The victim, Mantu Santra, has suffered 30% burn injuries on his face, neck and chest.

173.title: Kenyan national attacks pedestrians with knife near Bombay HC, held
173.article_body: One person suffered serious injuries after a Kenyan national attacked at least seven pedestrians near Bombay High Court on Wednesday. Mumbai Police arrested the 50-year-old foreigner who also sustained injuries. Police said the accused got violent after a verbal altercation with his female friend following which he went on to attack pedestrians randomly from Parsi Bawdi area with a knife.

174.title: BMC issues fresh directive against use of plastic, warns penal action
174.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday issued fresh directives for citizens and owners of commercial establishments not to use banned plastic. According to a BMC official, in case of violation, a fine of ₹5,000 will be imposed for first offence. Further, a fine of ₹25,000 and three-month jail term will be imposed for every offence thereafter, the official added.

175.title: Tunnel work of Pune Metro slowed by 400- metre long rock: Officials
175.article_body: Maha Metro officials said that the ongoing work on the Pune Metro has been slowed down by a 400-metre length of hard rock. Reports said that the metro tunnel boring machine's (TBM) drilling site is near Budhwar Peth. A Maha Metro official said that of the six-kilometre tunnel, 25-metre work is remaining.

176.title: India's 1st deluxe train Deccan Queen connecting Mumbai, Pune completes 92 yrs
176.article_body: India's first deluxe train, Deccan Queen Express, that connects Mumbai and Pune, completed 92 years of service on Wednesday. "This train is the only one of its kind on Indian Railways to have a restaurant car [and] will now run with LHB [Linke Hofmann Busch] coaches from June 22," Central Railway's General Manager Anil Kumar Lahoti, said.
